column4: i just installed conky. im trying to use a some conky scripts (conkytransmission), but i dont see a .conkyrc file after install and reboot. does anyone know how to customize conky?
are you enabling show hidden files?
ls -al, yes
alrighty, just checking :)
http://conky.sourceforge.net/docs.html  did you check for .conkyrc in /etc/conky/.conkyrc  ?
yes, its not there either. only conky.conf
hmmm ok.
ok, could try 'locate conkyrc' I suppose
file not found
... or maybe I could actually read the link I posted to you lol. /etc/conky/conky.conf is the sample configuration, 'cp /etc/conky/conky.conf /home/$USER/.conkyrc
im trying to get this running using my install of conky http://gnome-look.org/content/show.php/conkytransmission?content=129001
line 1 in the instructions. Do you have conky installed?
obviously..., its installed, i can run it, but there is no .conkyrc so the install script will not allow me to customize it. i try to create an artificial / fake one, and no effect

alright, then I should assume you installed transmission-cli and edited the preferences there.... according to the instructions, install.sh should create the sample .conkyrc for you, so it isn't then?
yes, exactly. this is the problem
then you should be seeking help from the author of that package.
see if 'cp ~/.conkytransmission/example.conkyrc ~/.conkyrc' creates it, that's all the install script does if you don't have one anyway.
bloody hell, it created it, but it broke conky lol!
figures >.<
thanks for your help, ill fiddle with the script to see if i can fix the conkyrc file
np
